meanings.definition: The quality or condition of being interdependent.
meanings.sent1: The interdependence of the team members ensured they relied on each other for success.
meanings.sent2: The interdependence of the ecosystem shows how each species relies on others for survival.
meanings.sent3: The interdependence of the siblings meant they had to work together to finish their chores.
meanings.sent4: The interdependence of the gears in the clockwork symbolized the unity of the system.
meanings.sent5: The interdependence of the puzzle pieces made it impossible to complete the picture without all of them.

meanings.definition: Mutual dependence between two or more things.
meanings.sent1: The interdependence of the plants and bees showed how they relied on each other for pollination.
meanings.sent2: The interdependence of trade between countries highlights the importance of global cooperation.
meanings.sent3: The interdependence of the ingredients in the recipe made it impossible to bake the cake without all of them.
meanings.sent4: The interdependence of the actors on stage created a seamless performance.
meanings.sent5: The interdependence of the wheels on the bicycle ensured smooth and efficient movement.
